New Records: Jaden Hardy scored a season-high 25 points off the bench
Key Match Events: Dallas used a late 16-0 run to beat the Portland Trail Blazers 117-111
Washington hit two free throws tying the score at 109-109 with 2:26 left and followed with a right-corner 3-pointer for a 112-109 lead with 1:58 to go
Quentin Grimes tipped back Spencer Dinwiddieâ€™s miss with 40 seconds left, then turned a one-hand heave into a three-point play to complete the 16-point run at 115-109 with 31.8 seconds left
Post-Match Reflections: The Mavericks have won two straight following a season-long five-game losing streak
Miscellaneous Highlights: Dallas outscored Portland 58-38 in the paint
The Blazers went in averaging 12.1 3-pointers and surpassed that late in the third period but were only 3 of 9 behind the arc in the fourth quarter
Others: The Mavericks are still without All-Star guards Luka Doncic and Kyrie Irving
Scoot Henderson scored 20 off the bench, hitting all 12 of his free throws
